page.title: 02Grafham, a changed community
page.content: Both settlements at{Grafham,}the settlement by the grove, and {Perry,}pear tree orchards, are mentioned in the{Domesday Book.}The Church at Perry no longer survives but there are still woodland and meadows in the area. Only two moats remain of the once important manor house of Grafham. The disused railway running through the north of the block bears witness to the passing of another era. However the creation of Grafham Water brought the greatest change. In a decade the centuries old quiet farming area has become a major tourist attraction for many miles around. Under the watchful eye of the Water Authority, County Planners and Conservation Bodies, it has become a recreational and ecological centre attracting many thousands of visitors.
